page.title: 12Employment in Nibley area
page.content: Traditionally several major industries have provided the main source of employment,e.g. Listers and Mawdsleys for engineering. Newer employers are the power station and laboratories at Berkeley. Workers can commute easily to Bristol, Gloucester & Cheltenham. Family farms employ no more than 2 workers apart from the owners.The 3 main categories of employment are: manufacturing,services and agriculture,in that order.This reliance on manufacturing in this area is in contrast to the county pattern where agriculture predominates.A Job Centre has opened in Dursley in the last few years.Training courses are available at Dursley,Stroud and Gloucester.A major problem for some workers and for trainees in particular is the lack of suitable bus routes.
